intro: Cryptantha aperta, commonly known as the open cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Cryptantha aperta is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a short-lived perennial.
